alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 12 at 3:13PM PDT until April 13 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT WEDNESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow above 2000 feet, but locally down to 1500 feet in the Ashland area and along the hills surrounding the Rogue Valley. Additional snow accumulations of 1 at lower elevations and up to 8 inches at higher elevations. * WHERE...Portions of eastern Curry County, Josephine County, and Jackson County including Ashland. Additionally, Interstate 5 in the Ashland area as well as over the Sexton and Canyon Mountain passes will also be affected. Portions of Highway 238 at Jacksonville Hill into the Applegate Valley. Portions of Highway 199 including Hayes Hill and south of Obrien at the Collier Tunnel. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult during periods of heavier snow showers and at higher elevations. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute on Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A cold front moving in from the northwest will bring the greatest snowfall rates late this evening through early Wednesday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County
